The Noun Phrase Modifier in English Grammar. More Information: adjective clause, adjective phrase, grammatical function, noun phrase, noun phrase modifier, prepositional phrase, relative clause, verb phrase. Noun phrase modifiers are defined as words, phrases, and clauses that describe a noun, pronoun, or noun phrase. Although adjectives and adjective phrases most frequently function to describe nouns, five grammatical forms can perform the grammatical function of noun phrase modifier in the English language.

The first grammatical form that can perform the grammatical function of noun phrase modifier is the noun phrase. Noun phrases are defined as phrases that consist of a noun including pronouns and any determinatives, modifiers, and complements such as adjectives, determiners, verbs, prepositions, and clauses.

: a phrase formed by a noun and all its modifiers and determiners; broadly: any syntactic element (as a clause, clitic, pronoun, or zero element) with a noun's function (as the subject of a verb or the object of a verb or preposition) —abbreviation NP.
